availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: John Hamby Harding (Harrison County, KY, farmer)

body.p: Harrison County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Married to J. H. Harding. Father of Mary Harding and Catherine D. Harding. Married to Pauline H. Asbury Harding. Father of Maggie V. Harding. Farmer in Harrison County, Kentucky, in 1860. Owned two enslaved persons in Harrison County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Harrison County, p. 690.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Harrison County, p. 128A.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Robertson County, Kentontown, p. 398A.
“Margaret Harding Conner,” Kentucky Death Certificates, 1911-1965, Kentucky Office of Vital Statistics, KDLA, Frankfort, KY, File 54-3577.
"John Hamby Harding (1816-1896)," Find A Grave, Memorial 225578639, accessed January 28, 2024, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/225578639.
